Posts.Content: Brief Case Details   A.     Patient Age: 76 years; maintains reasonably good health. Diabetic/ hypertensive. Other vitals of heart, liver etc ok B.     Carcinoma of Breast (Left) Modified Radical Mastectomy (MRM) completed on 29.07.2010 C.     Histo Biopsy Large (others) Tumor size 4 X 3 Cms with infiltrative margins Auxillary lymphnodes number 15, largest measuring 1.8 cms, belongs to level I Level I – 13 lymph nodes – All free (0/13) Level II – 2 lymph nodes – All free (0/2) DCIS – absent ; Lymphatic/ Vascular Emboli – present ; Stromal desmoplasia - present Opinion: Infiltrating Duct Carcinoma (NOS), Grade 3, Score 8, left breast (pT2N0) D.    Histo Biopsy MRM / BCS with Tissue Immunohistochemistry IHC marker                                  Allred Score               Interpretation Estrogen Receptor (ER)                           0/8                           Negative Progestrone Receptor (PR)          0/8                           Negative Her-2-Neu-1757/10 (S-7586/10) Marker                                         Score                           Result Her-2-neu (c-erb B2)                     3+                                Positive   Repeat Test ER/ PR repeat test from Ranbaxy laboratory in Mumbai: ER/PR not detected Her-2-neu repeat test by FISH method indicates no amplification of the HER-2/neu gene
Posts.Title: Should chemo be given after MRM in 76 year old lady patient
